inlineContent.text: Do your customers complain about specific crashes, but you cannot reproduce it, and you wish you could see a stack trace to help you find the root cause?
Your customers say your app is too slow, but this is not the case on your testing device?
Your app works flawlessly on your testing device, but it crashes on your customers’s devices?
Learn how to use Firebase to improve the quality of your app.
Send push notifications to your app
Track, prioritize, and fix crashes faster
Gain insight into your app’s performance issues
Test your app on devices hosted in a Google data center.

doc://MakeItSoTutorials/tutorials/MakeIt.title: Gain insight into your app's performance issues

abstract.text: Firebase Performance Monitoring is a service that helps you to gain insight into the performance characteristics of your Apple, Android, and web apps.

You use the Performance Monitoring SDK to collect performance data from your app, then review and analyze that data in the Firebase console. Performance Monitoring helps you to understand in real time where the performance of your app can be improved so that you can use that information to fix performance issues.

doc://MakeItSoTutorials/tutorials/MakeIt.title: Add Push Notifications to an iOS app

abstract.text: Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM) is a cross-platform messaging solution that lets you reliably send messages at no cost.
Do your customers complain about specific crashes, but you cannot reproduce it, and you wish you could see a stack trace to help you find the root cause?

doc://MakeItSoTutorials/tutorials/MakeIt.title: Test your app on devices hosted in a Google data center

abstract.text: Firebase Test Lab is a cloud-based app testing infrastructure that lets you test your app on a range of devices and configurations, so you can get a better idea of how it’ll perform in the hands of live users.
This tutorial guides you through setting up Firebase Crashlytics in your app with the Firebase Crashlytics SDK so that you can get comprehensive crash reports in the Firebase console.
